title.narrative: Improving access to essential and life-saving health services for conflict-affected population in three States of Sudan

description.narrative:
The project is aimed at improving access to essential and life-saving health services to help reduce morbidity and mortality attributed to the conflict and imminent public health emergencies in the conflict-affected areas targeted by the project. To this end, the project supports establishment and running of mobile and static-health facilities and procurement and distribution of essential medicines, surgical supplies, and other laboratory items to the health facilities to improve access and utilization of health services by the affected population in the targeted six localities of the three States. Also, in order to prevent, detect and respond to imminent epidemic-prone infectious diseases outbreaks in such conflict settings, the project trains Rapid Response Team (RRT) and health workers on surveillance and case management.
The project directly targets 391,380 affected people with its Health engagement.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Improving access to essential and life-saving health services for conflict-affected population in three States of Sudan

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SUDAN UNDERFUNDED EMERGENCIES POST-CONFLICT NEEDS 2022

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Improved access to essential and life-saving health services to IDPs, nomads, and host communities affected by inter-communal conflict in the targeted six localities of West Darfur, South Darfur and North Darfur States in Sudan
H.1a Number of emergency health kits delivered to healthcare facilities (IEHK)
H.1a Number of emergency health kits delivered to healthcare facilities (TESK)
H.2 Number of people receiving surgical procedures for trauma
H.7 Number of functional health facilities supported ((mobile clinic or fixed health facilities)
H.8 Number of primary healthcare consultations provided (i.e. 1 visit per person per year)
Number of quarterly joint supervisions to the project activities

Strengthened disease surveillance (including vector surveillance) and outbreak control interventions in the targeted localities and affected populations in West Darfur, South Darfur and North Darfur States in Sudan
CC.1 Number of implementing partner staff receiving training to support programme implementation (RRTs (5 individual per team) and health workers trained on surveillance and case management)
H.5. Percentage of public health alerts generated through community-based or health-facility-based surveillance or alert systems investigated within 24 hours
Number of vector surveillance missions to 24 sentinel sites supported
Number of waste management campaigns conducted in the 22 health facilities supported by the project
